title: Firefox screenshot crops images when zoomed in and pads images when zoomed out enough
content:
Hi Community!

I'm having issues with the Firefox Screenshots tool, with cropping issues similar to others using page zoom. But I see that most of those problems have been archived, so I cannot add to them. I am currently using the latest version of Firefox 119.0.

I'm also using Windows 11's feature of Display Scaling to 125%. This zooming is independent of Firefox's page zoom. I have included various screenshots of various configurations of the two scaling/zoom features to show the cropping effect.

Firefox Screenshot tool of a selected area: - Screenshot #1 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 100% (no zoom) and Firefox page zoom 100% (no zoom), no cropping - Screenshot #2 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 125% only, cropping on right and bottom - Screenshot #3 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 125% and Firefox page zoom 80%, no cropping - Screenshot #4 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 100% (no zoom) and Firefox page zoom 120%, cropping on right and bottom

Firefox Screenshot tool of full page: - Screenshot #5 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 100% (no zoom) and Firefox page zoom 100% (no zoom), no cropping - Screenshot #6 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 125% only, cropping on right and bottom compared to what I see on the screen - Screenshot #7 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 125% and Firefox page zoom 80%, no cropping - Screenshot #8 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 100% (no zoom) and Firefox page zoom 120%, cropping on right and bottom compared to what I see on the screen - Screenshot #9 - Windows 11 Display Scaling 100% (no zoom) and Firefox page zoom 80%, no cropping but transparent padding added to the right and bottom of the image

Curiously, I also noticed a difference in the image dimensions of the full page screenshots, whereas there were no dimension differences for the partial/selected area screenshots: - Screenshot #5 - 2560x1307 - Screenshot #6 - 2050x1080 (strange dimensions, i tried again later after various Display Scaling and page zooming and I got 2050x1082) - Screenshot #7 - 2560x1274 (strangely it's almost but not the exact same size of the no zoom) - Screenshot #8 - 2133x1089 (which is exactly 2560x1307 divided by the zoom of 120%) - Screenshot #9 - 3198x1631 (which is almost but not exactly 2560x1307 divided by the zoom of 80%, checking in the Photoshop, the non-padded part of the image does measure 2560x1307)

Why is this change in dimensions occurring? I would have assumed that when someone zooms in or out this would affect the viewable webpage with some elements shifting around at times, and when they screenshot it, they want what's viewed captured exactly. As such for the full page screenshots, i would have expected them all to have the same width at least, as there is no horizontal scrolling involved only possible changes in the vertical dimension would occur. Or is this all an effect of the zoomed screenshot cropping bug?

So i guess I have issues with cropping and a potential issue with zoomed-in (and Windows 11 Display Scale enlarged) full page screenshots not being the true viewed dimensions. There's also an issue of image padding when zoomed-out enough.
creator: icyicecream

title: getting pop-ups from an uninstalled program
content: Yesterday i uninstalled Grammarly but today i am still getting pop-ups saying Grammarly isn't activated yet, but it's been uninstalled! So how do i make the pop-ups stop? That's the whole reason i uninstalled it in the first place.

title: Twitter hover elements not working
content: When i hover over profiles on twitter, the usual thing that appears showing a brief description of said profile does not appear. Hover elements work completely fine on other websites like facebook for example, its something with FF only. Tried reinstalling and other methods found on reddit forums that do not work at all.
creator: leoksaraiva

title: ArcGIS pages will not load the map
content:
Using Firefox 119.0

I cannot load GIS pages on Firefox but can do so very quickly with Chrome.

These are the pages I tried to view: https://www.arcgis.com/apps/dashboards/eafaa058f0c04865adb32127f9bd82df

https://gis-michigan.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/egle::egle-conservation-easements/explore

I even tried changing Smart block settings by setting "extensions.webcompat.enable_shims" to "False" (as per https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/smartblock-enhanced-tracking-protection).

I also tried accessing these pages in Troubleshot mode, but no luck.

Any thoughts?

Thank you,
creator: msprinker

title: Cannot watch streami9ng movies on Netflix in Firefox browser??
content: Every time I open Netflix in Firefox browser, to watch streaming movies, it won't show them but keeps taking me to a page asking me to log in again or pay for a Netflix account. (attached) I already have a Netflix account and can watch streaming movies with no problems on other browsers, but not using Firefox, which is my Default browser.
